episodes.title: Escaping the Brethren: Life After the Cult – Lavinia’s Story (Part 2)
episodes.description:
In Part 1, Lavinia set the tone for her life inside the Brethren. Now, in Part 2, she takes us deeper — detailing her harrowing escape, the steep cost of freedom, and the courage it took to walk away from everything she had ever known and loved.

Her voice is powerful and unflinching. Her pain, remarkable. And her return to self — nothing short of inspiring. This is not just a story of survival, but of reclaiming identity, autonomy, and life itself.

⚠ Trigger Warning:
This episode contains discussion of:
Suicide
Religious trauma
Emotional abuse
Estrangement from family
Escaping from cults
Mental health struggles
These topics may be distressing to some listeners. Please take care while listening and step away if you need to.
📞 If you need support:
Lifeline Australia – 13 11 14 (24/7 crisis support)
Beyond Blue – 1300 22 4636 (mental health support)
Suicide Call Back Service – 1300 659 467
Olive Branch – https://www.theolivebranch.org.au (support for those leaving high-control groups)
If outside Australia – Find local crisis lines here: https://findahelpline.com

episodes.title: Escaping the Brethren: Life After the Cult - Part 1 — Lavinia’s Story
episodes.description:
In this powerful episode, Lavinia shares her lived experience of growing up inside the Brethren—a high-control religious cult where independence, higher education, and freedom of thought were denied.

We explore the emotional, spiritual, and psychological impacts of life in the Brethren, and what it really means to untangle yourself from a belief system designed to keep you silent.

⚠️ Trigger Warning: This episode includes discussion of religious trauma, emotional manipulation, coercive control, and systemic silencing. Please listen with care.

If this episode brings up anything for you, please reach out. Support is available:

The Olive Branch Network (Support for cult survivors)
🌐 ⁠www.olivebranch.network⁠
📧 ⁠hello@olivebranch.network⁠

Lifeline Australia – 24/7 Crisis Support
📞 13 11 14
🌐 ⁠www.lifeline.org.au⁠

1800RESPECT – National Family, Domestic & Sexual Violence Support
📞 1800 737 732
🌐 ⁠www.1800respect.org.au⁠

Religious Trauma Institute (International support and resources)
🌐 ⁠www.religioustraumainstitute.com⁠

🧠 Need Support? You're Not Alone.
